::DarkMouse::

Now she knew what had made her crindge. This wasn't a normal 
predacon. No predacon would ask for another's trust.  A normal 
Predacon would tell her to shut up or die, or outright shoot her. No, 
this bot was something else.  She just didn't know what.  She stood 
by him, not making a sound. She carefully put her hand on his 
shoulder and listened for the maximal reply.  She looked down, closed 
her eyes and smiled.  She couldn't help but like him.  Maybe her 
comeback from the matrix had changed her in some small way, she 
thought.  Or maybe she needed her logic circuits checked, but she 
found herself wanting to believe him. 



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, kinger01030@c... wrote:
>  Destructor didn't look back.."Do not be afraid. I will not let any 
harm come 
> to you. Have a little faith in me. Now quiet we must wait for the 
maximals 
> answer."
